messages.subject: Thank you
messages.msgSnippet: I am learning or should I say unlearning so much from all of you and your replies. I am looking at homeschooling with much less stress than before. Here I
messages.messageBody:
I am learning or should I say unlearning so much from all of you and your replies. I am looking at homeschooling with much less stress than before. Here I thought I was a failure because I wasn't forcing bookwork but encouraging Internet searches on topics that come up like the volcano, it brought about discussion this morning so we looked it up. We are becoming more eager to learn and happier all around.

Alisha Grinus www.Scentsy.com/redsmoon twistedsisters4jewelry.ecrater.com

messages.subject: Thank you
messages.msgSnippet: But this post ist just a thank you post. It s appreciated more than you know. Most of us are more than willing to answer questions over and over and over
messages.messageBody:
"But this post ist just a thank you post."

It's appreciated more than you know.
Most of us are more than willing to answer questions over and over and
over gain (I'm constantly in AWE at Joyces posts that are immensely
detailed year after year) but it's always nice to have a little
appreciation. I can admit that I'm not totally selfless about this
whole thing!!;)

Please don't be afraid to ask your questions, that's what the list is
for.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Thank you
messages.msgSnippet: Hi there, I was just thinking about this list and was overwhelmed by a feeling which I wanted to share: I want to say thank you to all of you who have
messages.messageBody:
Hi there,

I was just thinking about this list and was overwhelmed by a feeling
which I wanted to share: I want to say thank you to all of you who
have experience in this and who don't really need to be in this list
(anymore), yet you do to help us newcomers.

I find it so hard to change my parenting "style" and I really need
this list and other sources for help. It feels like "the world upside
down". Everything is quite the opposite of what I was used to and I
have a million questions. I hesitate to ask because I don't want to
bother you all, you surely answered all these questions already a
million times. I know this list is for asking but still :-) I can't
help it. I will eventually though.

But this post ist just a thank you post.

Thank you!

Johanna

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Thank you

messages.subject: Thank you
messages.msgSnippet: So,gayle, by posting and really giving where you were , you gave me the words to where I was, and all the rest of you who responded to her, you helped me ,
messages.messageBody:
"So,gayle, by posting and really giving where you were , you gave me
the words to
where I was, and all the rest of you who responded to her, you helped
me , too."

I think that's one of the great things about online conversations...it
happens quite often I think, that many people benefit from a
conversation that starts out about one person.
I know I've had lots of "aha" moments from conversations I didn't even
get involved in.

So I'm glad there were some useful bits there for you. Maybe we could
start a "controllers anonymous" 12 step program!! :)

Ren

messages.subject: Thank you
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the responses to me freaking out about a 3rd child! I m feeling calmer now. Caroline is so easy going that it will take effort not to neglect her. I
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the responses to me freaking out about a 3rd child! I'm
feeling calmer now.

Caroline is so easy going that it will take effort not to neglect
her. I won't let that happen. Dh was the neglected youngest of 5 kids
and she's so much like him, so I think we'll do just fine.

Thanks again,
aj
